Questions.question: Baby Guacamole is for what age?
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: 1 avocado -- 1/2 fl oz tomato juice -- little fresh coriander (cilantro), chopped -- little ground cumin -- Mash the avocado, then stir in the remaining ingredients and serve as a dip.

Questions.question: Pureed Baby Food Recipe – Tender Carrots: You want to choose what carrots?
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Choose large, older carrots – these are actually richer in nutrients than baby carrots. Just trim the ends and slice. Then steam, boil or microwave and puree to perfection!

Questions.question: Sweet potato and melon mash: Other than these two ingredients, you can add...
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: In a food processor, blend together the a cup of melon and a cup of sweet potato. Add 1/4 cup of yogurt and blend for a further 30 secs. Sprinkle with a little powdered ginger (optional) and refrigerate.

Questions.question: How do you serve banana puree?
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Mash banana with a fork, adding 1 tablespoon water, formula, or breast milk to reach desired consistency. Serve immediately.

Questions.question: What is this puree?
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: Peas may thicken slightly and stick together after they're refrigerated. To loosen them, stir in a small amount of water, formula, or breast milk when reheating.

Questions.question: This puree could make you nervous when you see your baby's dirty diaper
Questions.correct_ans_explanation: The bright-red color of beets is appealing to babies, but be careful since this vegetable easily stains clothes. If you notice that subsequent diapers take on a reddish tint, don’t be alarmed; it’s normal for babies who eat beets.
